faq.title: ‚ùì Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.subtitle: Quickly find answers to the most common questions

fundsSafe.a: Yes! Your funds are secured in an audited smart contract on the Base blockchain. No one (not even us) can touch them before the scheduled date. You keep 100% control.

ifConfidanceDisappears.a: Your payments will continue to work! Smart contracts are on the blockchain and operate autonomously. Even if our site is offline, payments will be automatically released.

whatFees.a: There are 2 types of fees: 1) Blockchain fees (gas): ~0.002 ETH at creation. 2) Protocol fees: 1.79% of the amount, automatically deducted upon release.

feeExample.a: To send 0.1 ETH: Gas fees (creation): 0.002 ETH. Protocol fees (1.79%): 0.00179 ETH. Recipient receives: 0.09821 ETH.

canCancel.a: Yes, if you checked "Allow cancellation" when creating it. Cancellation must be done BEFORE the scheduled date. You recover 100% of the amount (no fees).

minDate.a: You can schedule a payment in a few minutes or in several years. There is no limit.

blockchain.a: We use Base Mainnet (Ethereum Layer 2). It's fast, secure and with very low fees.

tokens.a: ERC20 support coming soon! For now, only native ETH is available.

metamaskRecurring.q: Why several MetaMask windows for a recurring payment?
metamaskRecurring.a:
For a recurring payment (e.g. 1 USDC √ó 3 months), you see 3 steps:

1) First approval ‚Äî You allow the platform to use your tokens to create the contract.

2) Creation ‚Äî The transaction that records your schedule (amount, duration, beneficiary).

3) Second approval ‚Äî You allow the created contract to deduct the total of all installments (e.g. 3 USDC for 3 months).

This is how tokens work: each "spender" must be approved separately.

Multiple recipients: there may be additional MetaMask windows (one approval per contract per beneficiary).
